headline: ServiceNow mulls $7bn acquisition of Armis
summary: Founded in 2016 and based in California, Armis specialises in cyber risk management and digital infrastructure security.

content.title: ServiceNow mulls $7bn acquisition of Armis
content.summary: Founded in 2016 and based in California, Armis specialises in cyber risk management and digital infrastructure security.

thumbnail.caption: Strategic mergers and acquisitions over the past two years have expanded Armis' capabilities in cloud computing

headline: KeyBanc downgrades Adobe and ServiceNow on AI risks
summary: Investing.com -- KeyBanc Capital Markets has downgraded both ServiceNow and Adobe to Underweight, arguing that risks around artificial intelligence, valuation and growth momentum are rising as the enterprise software sector heads into 2026.

content.title: KeyBanc downgrades Adobe and ServiceNow on AI risks
content.summary: Investing.com -- KeyBanc Capital Markets has downgraded both ServiceNow and Adobe to Underweight, arguing that risks around artificial intelligence, valuation and growth momentum are rising as the enterprise software sector heads into 2026.

headline: iRobot files for bankruptcy, ServiceNow to acquire Armis for $7B
summary: Morning Brief host Julie Hyman tracks several of the day's top trending stock tickers, including Roomba maker iRobot (IRBT) filing for Chapter 11 bankruptcy, ServiceNow (NOW) reportedly preparing to acquire Armis in a $7 billion deal, and Texas Instruments (TXN) receiving a double downgrade to Sell by Goldman Sachs analysts. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

content.title: iRobot files for bankruptcy, ServiceNow to acquire Armis for $7B
content.description:
Morning Brief host Julie Hyman tracks several of the day's top trending stock tickers, including Roomba maker iRobot (IRBT) filing for Chapter 11 bankruptcy, ServiceNow (NOW) reportedly preparing to acquire Armis in a $7 billion deal, and Texas Instruments (TXN) receiving a double downgrade to Sell by Goldman Sachs analysts.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.
content.summary: Morning Brief host Julie Hyman tracks several of the day's top trending stock tickers, including Roomba maker iRobot (IRBT) filing for Chapter 11 bankruptcy, ServiceNow (NOW) reportedly preparing to acquire Armis in a $7 billion deal, and Texas Instruments (TXN) receiving a double downgrade to Sell by Goldman Sachs analysts. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

summary: ↘️ iRobot (IRBT): The Roomba maker declared bankruptcy over the weekend. It said customer service and app functionality will continue normally during the restructuring. Shares tumbled nearly 70% Monday morning.

headline: ServiceNow shares plunge on Armis deal speculation
summary: Investing.com -- ServiceNow shares plunged more than 9% at the open on Monday after a report that the software group is in advanced talks to acquire cybersecurity firm Armis for up to $7 billion.

content.title: ServiceNow shares plunge on Armis deal speculation
